title: Zelensky: Ukraine applying to NATO in 'accelerated procedure'
The turning points in Russia's invasion of Ukraine
The turning points in Russia's invasion of Ukraine
Sailor charged with starting fire that destroyed US Navy ship found not guilty
Late night hosts mock fan's name after missing Aaron Judge's home run ball
description: Late night hosts tease Toronto Blue Jays fan, Frankie Lasagna, whose name went viral after he almost caught Aaron Judge's historic 61st home run ball.

title: Before and after images show Ian's destruction
description:
• Ian downgraded to tropical depression
• As Ian continues to weaken farther island, recovery efforts are underway in Florida and South Carolina

title: Historic discovery of skull in China reveals missing link of human evolution
description: Chinese archaeologists discovered an incredibly well-preserved 1-million-year-old Homo erectus skull, filling a major gap in our understanding of human evolution.

title: 'Deliberate act of sabotage': Biden addresses Nord Stream pipeline leaks
description: In a speech from the White House, President Joe Biden accused President Vladimir Putin of putting on a "sham routine" around Russia's annexation of Ukrainian territories and called the Nord Stream pipeline leaks a "deliberate act of sabotage."

title: Why the world is watching Brazil's heated election
description: • Opinion: Bolsonaro follows Trump's lead

title: Jailed dissident Alexey Navalny says Russia must be transformed after war
description: Imprisoned Russian dissident Alexey Navalny says the only way for his country to avoid an "endless cycle of imperial authoritarianism" is to become a parliamentary democracy.

title: Hear Putin's announcement about citizens in newly annexed regions
description: CNN international security editor Nick Paton Walsh reports on Vladimir Putin's speech announcing the annexation of four areas of Ukraine that the West denounced as illegal.

title: Opinion: Casting doubt on Brazil's election, Bolsonaro follows Trump's lead
description: "A new class of thieves has emerged who want to steal our freedom," Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro thundered during a speech last June. The beleaguered leader, who has been trailing badly in recent polls ahead of Sunday's election, went on to declare that "if necessary, we will go to war" against the offenders.

title: How a debate over textbooks closed 150 schools in East Jerusalem
Must-watch videos of the week
Ted Cruz's latest comments expose the truth about Trump & the GO
description: Sen. Ted Cruz said it is "utter garbage" when potential Republican candidates pronounce that they would run in 2024 whether or not former President Donald Trump does. In today's episode of The Point, CNN's Chris Cillizza discusses how the Texas senator evolved from calling Trump a "sniveling coward" to becoming an astute observer of Trump's hold on the GOP.

title: William, the new Prince of Wales, has taken on a crucial new role
description: A sense of normality slowly returned to the monarchy this week, as the royals' extended period of mourning following the death of Queen Elizabeth II came to an end.

title: Historic 207-year-old outdoor swimming pool reopens in England
description: With its honey-colored stone, crescent-shaped changing rooms, still water and idyllic location on the banks of the Avon river in Bath, England, Cleveland Pools seems to have been plucked from the pages of a Jane Austen novel or an episode of "Bridgerton."

title: Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson takes ceremonial oath at Supreme Court
description: Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson took the judicial oath Friday at a special sitting of the Supreme Court attended by President Joe Biden as well as legal luminaries from across Washington who gathered to celebrate the first time a Black woman has taken her seat on the highest court in the land.

title: San Francisco warns robotaxis can be a self-driving nightmare
description: GM's self-driving car subsidiary Cruise said earlier this year that it wants to add as many as 5,000 more robotaxis to American streets, including in San Francisco, where it currently maintains a fleet of fewer than 100 cars. But the city says the robotaxis are already shaping up to be a self-driving nightmare at times and warns that a much larger fleet could worsen safety and traffic.

title: US imposing 'swift and severe costs' on Russia
description: The US is imposing what it describes as "swift and severe costs" on Russia, including sanctions on a figure the Biden administration says is key to Russia's economy, after President Vladimir Putin announced the annexation of regions of Ukraine following what the West casts as "sham referenda."

title: EU agrees to tax windfall oil and gas profits amid 'insane race' to tame energy crisis
description: EU governments agreed Friday to tax the windfall profits of oil and gas companies and to cap the revenues of some electricity generators as the cost of Europe's energy crisis spirals higher.

title: George Clooney reacts to 'pretty boy' Brad Pitt calling him the 'most handsome man'
description: George Clooney and Brad Pitt can't quit teasing each other.

title: Elon Musk's texts show how his relationship with Twitter went sideways
description: Days before publicly announcing his investment in Twitter, Elon Musk texted with Jack Dorsey. The former Twitter CEO suggested he no longer believed in the company he founded, according to new court filings in the legal battle between Musk and Twitter.

title: Analysis: Illegal annexation fails to hide gulf between what Putin wants and what his forces can hold
description: It is a moment of two completely incompatible events. One staged in Moscow, of a pen on paper, theater and imperialist expansion. The other the slow, methodical advance of Ukraine's forces through poorly supplied and commanded Russian positions.

title: Can Porsche cure an ailing IPO market?
Putin announces illegal annexation of four regions of Ukraine
Big tech becomes new player in watching live sports
description: Puck's founding partner Matthew Belloni tells "Nightcap's" Jon Sarlin how big tech is spending big money to compete in live sports broadcasting to lure more subscribers to its streaming platforms. For more, watch the full Nightcap episode here.

title: See why a woman is cutting her hair over her brother's coffin
description: Women have been a driving force behind anti-regime protests in Iran after 22-year-old Mahsa Amini died while in the custody of Iran's morality police for allegedly not abiding to the country's hijab rules.

title: Brazilian soccer star Neymar Jr. faces criticism for Bolsonaro support
description: Just days ahead of Brazil's national elections on Sunday, soccer star Neymar Jr. has appeared in a campaign video endorsing Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro.

title: Putin announces Russia will annex four regions of Ukraine
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has formally announced the Kremlin's intention to annex nearly a fifth of Ukraine in blatant violation of international law.

title: SNL is back. Here are the stories behind the show's iconic photos
'Interview With the Vampire' pumps fresh blood into Anne Rice's story on AMC
description: Significantly improving upon the 1994 film, "Anne Rice's Interview With the Vampire" does more than just add the late author's name to the title, ambitiously updating the story, introducing a racial component and serving up plenty of sex and gore. Desperate to replace "The Walking Dead," AMC might have completed an improbable baton pass from zombies to another kind of undead.

title: Russia expert on Putin's plan: 'Defeat is not an option'
description: President Vladimir Putin sets to hold a Kremlin ceremony to formalize the illegal annexation of four occupied regions of eastern Ukraine. CNN's Nic Robertson looks back at Putin's similar move in the annexation of Crimea in 2014.

title: FIDE set to launch investigation into chess cheating allegations
description: An investigation is set to launched in the wake of cheating allegations made by world chess champion Magnus Carlsen, FIDE -- the sport's global governing body -- announced on Thursday.

title: Anyone can now use powerful AI tools to make images. What could possibly go wrong?
description: If you've ever wanted to use artificial intelligence to quickly design a hybrid between a duck and a corgi, now is your time to shine.

title: First on CNN: US government to provide $266 million to build community, public health work force
description: The US government is awarding more than $266 million from the American Rescue Plan to expand the nation's community and public health work force, officials will announce Friday.

title: The UK economy still hasn't recovered from the pandemic. Now it's on the ropes again
description: There was good news and bad in Friday's revised data about the UK economy. It grew — marginally — in the second quarter of the year, rather than shrinking as previously estimated.

title: 5 women who should have won a Nobel Prize
description: It was an all-male lineup of laureates for last year's Nobel Prizes in medicine, physics and chemistry, awards which grant the recipients entry to the most prestigious club in science.

title: The couple who spent their honeymoon riding an African iron ore train
description: When planning a honeymoon, many couples go for obvious destinations like Paris, the city of love, or the Maldives, with its stunning azure waters.

title: Swiss court finds in favor of Lindt and orders Lidl to destroy its chocolate bunnies
description: Lindt & Spruengli's foil-wrapped chocolate bunnies deserve protection from copycat products, Switzerland's highest court ruled on Thursday, and ordered German discounter Lidl to stop selling a similar product in Switzerland and to destroy its remaining stock.

title: Booker prize nominated author convicted for staging solo protest in Zimbabwe
description: Award-winning Zimbabwean author Tsitsi Dangarembga has been found guilty of staging a protest with the intent of inciting public violence, a court in the capital Harare ruled Thursday.

title: Next year's Met Gala theme revealed
description: Organizers of the annual Met Gala, one of fashion's biggest nights, have announced next year's theme: celebrating the work of the late Karl Lagerfeld.

title: King Charles III's coin portrait unveiled by UK Royal Mint
description: The portrait of King Charles III that will feature on British coins has been unveiled by the Royal Mint, the official maker of UK coins.

title: Former Dallas Cowboys tight end Gavin Escobar found dead after apparent rock climbing accident
description: Former Dallas Cowboys tight end Gavin Escobar was one of two climbers who died after an apparent accident in California, officials announced on Wednesday. Escobar was 31 years old.

title: Ketanji Brown Jackson's first few months at the fractured Supreme Court
description: Supreme Court Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson has joined an institution of isolated chambers and archaic procedures. It is also a place that has lost the public's trust. So, as she navigates the cloistered corridors, she'll also have to watch her footing in the ongoing debate over the institution's legitimacy.

title: House expected to vote to approve government funding to avert shutdown
description: The House of Representatives is expected to vote Friday to approve a stop-gap bill to fund the government through December 16 and avert a shutdown at the end of the week.

title: 'Remarkable': Expert on Putin's rare admission of mistake
description: In a rare admission, Russian President Vladimir Putin said mistakes were made while selecting the 300,000 men eligible to be called up during the current mobilization. CNN's National Security Analyst David Sanger joins John Vause to discuss.

title: Behind the unfounded rumor of a military 'coup' against China's president
description: When Chinese leader Xi Jinping vanished from public view after an overseas visit, unfounded rumors of a "coup" sparked a frenzy of speculation ahead of a key Communist Party meeting. As Xi reemerged on Chinese state media, the online frenzy was quashed. CNN's Will Ripley looks into where these rumors started.

title: Look of the Week: Kanye West is apparently team socks and sandals
description: Fashion forward to some, and a faux pas to others, wearing socks with sandals has been a sartorial boundary that many celebrities have transgressed.

title: Tampa Bay Buccaneers will donate to hurricane relief
description: Tampa Bay Buccaneers quarterback Tom Brady and the team's owners, the Glazer family, both announced on Thursday that they will make donations towards Hurricane Ian relief efforts.

title: Officials say 23 people are dead in an attack by Russian forces. Meanwhile, Russia's annexation agreements are expected to be signed today.
The latest on Russia's war in Ukraine
Storm system has intensified to a Category 1 hurricane as officials assess the destruction wrought in Florida that is being characterized as likely the largest natural disaster in the state's history
After slamming Florida, Hurricane Ian barrels toward South Carolina
Led by Hong Kong, Asian stocks on track to suffer worst month since Covid began
description: Asian markets are careening toward their worst month since the Covid pandemic began, hit by a mighty US dollar and rising global recession fears.

title: Hurricane Ian leaves multiple dead and millions without power across Florida
In ghostly Sviatogirsk, Russia's challenge in annexing territory it cannot control is laid bare
description:
• LIVE: Annexation agreements to be signed
• Analysis: Putin's new land grab is dangerous for Ukraine -- and the world

title: Multiple dead and millions without power across Florida
description: As Florida contends with the ruinous damage left behind by Hurricane Ian in what officials say is likely the largest natural disaster in the state's history, residents in South Carolina are bracing for the storm's expected landfall mid-day Friday.

title: Casualties reported after explosion at educational center in Kabul
description: Casualties have been reported in Afghanistan's capital Kabul following an explosion at an educational center, the city's police said.

title: Anti-Asian hate crimes are scaring Chinese travelers away from the US
description: Cannon Yu lives in Shantou, Guangdong province.

title: Putin's new land grab is dangerous for Ukraine -- and the world
Putin's new land grab is dangerous for Ukraine -- and the world
description: Russia's new land grab in Ukraine is an act of geopolitical piracy that will make the war more dangerous, add new risk to the West's strategic calculations and deal a long-term challenge to the international rule of law.

title: How this ingredient in some cosmetics can cause serious health risks
description: CNN explains how high levels of mercury found in some skin whitening creams can affect the body of people using them and put entire households at risk by contaminating their homes.

title: California bars tech companies from complying with other states' abortion-related warrants
description: California is attempting to stymie abortion prosecutions in other states by making it illegal for Silicon Valley giants and other businesses based in the Golden State to hand over the personal information of abortion-seekers to out-of-state authorities.

title: Former NSA employee charged with violating Espionage Act after trying to sell US secrets
description: A former employee of the National Security Agency was arrested Wednesday on espionage-related charges for allegedly trying to sell US secrets, the Justice Department announced.

title: Trevor Noah is leaving 'The Daily Show'
description: "The Daily Show" host Trevor Noah has announced on he will step away from the anchor desk.

title: Ian intensifies into hurricane again as it heads towards South Carolina
See the highlights of the first episode of 'The Daily Show with Trevor Noah'
description: After 16 seasons, Trevor Noah replaced Jon Stewart as the host of Comedy Central's "The Daily Show." In the first episode, Noah discussed Pope emojis and John Boehner.

title: CDC warns of severe illnesses from monkeypox as Ohio reports death of a monkeypox patient
description: The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention issued a new warning to health care providers Thursday about severe illnesses in people with monkeypox.

title: Miami Dolphins quarterback Tua Tagovailoa taken off the field on stretcher during game against Bengals
description: The Miami Dolphins quarterback Tua Tagovailoa was taken off the field on a stretcher on Thursday during a game against the Cincinnati Bengals, after suffering apparent head and neck injuries.

title: Massive boats end up on dry land following Hurricane Ian
description: CNN's Randi Kaye shows the devastating aftermath of Hurricane Ian in Fort Myers, Florida.

title: Trump attorney and adviser testified before Georgia grand jury investigating election interference
description: Boris Epshteyn, an attorney and adviser to former President Donald Trump, testified before a Georgia grand jury investigating efforts to overturn the 2020 election, according to two people familiar with the matter.

title: Michelle Kwan confirmed as US ambassador to Belize
description: The Senate on Thursday confirmed Michelle Kwan, a former Olympic figure skater and longtime Democratic activist, to serve as ambassador to Belize.

title: These bamboo shelters are empowering communities displaced by Pakistan's floods
description: Pakistan's "never-before-seen" floods have affected 33 million people, many of whom are still seeking safe refuge after record monsoon rains damaged or destroyed more than a million homes. The summer's catastrophic flooding, which was exacerbated by melting glaciers, has submerged one-third of the country, with authorities saying it could take up to six months for the water to recede.

title: These Maldives resorts are leading the charge on sustainability
description: As the lowest-lying nation in the world -- with much of it sitting just a few feet above sea level -- the nearly 1,200 Indian Ocean islands scattered across the Maldives' sun-soaked atolls are famed not just for their magazine-cover-ready beaches and bungalows, but for their increasing vulnerability to rising sea levels.

title: 'There used to be houses here': CNN flies above Ian devastation
description: CNN's John Berman flies above the destruction left behind by Hurricane Ian in Lee County, Florida.

title: Biden administration scales back student loan forgiveness plan as states sue
description: The Biden administration scaled back eligibility for its student loan forgiveness plan Thursday, the same day six Republican-led states sued President Joe Biden in an effort to block his student loan forgiveness plan from taking effect.

title: Pentagon working to form new command to coordinate arming and training Ukraine
description: The Pentagon is working to form a new command to coordinate arming and training Ukraine, according to two US officials, in an effort to streamline what was a largely ad hoc process rapidly created in the wake of Russia's invasion.
